subject: junit and servlet applications
msgSnippet: I m new with JUnit and I m considering the possibility to use it in my applications. However I m puzzled how this can be done because all the classes that are
messageBody:
I 'm new with JUnit and I'm considering the possibility to use it in
my applications. However I'm puzzled how this can be done because all
the classes that are used in my applications depend heavily on a
framework. To explain:

I 'm using this framework to write my servlet applications. The
framework consists of a main servlet that calls utility classes. This
framework manages database connections and other resources via an
environment object which is initialized every time I run my
application and I request the first web page. This enviroment object
is passed to every utility class I use in my application. Each class
uses the environment object to make for example database queries, for
session management, to get a handle to HttpRequest, HttpResponse and
servlet objects and other useful things.

In a case like this how could I use JUnit? How can I initialize the
environment object from the setUp method of a TestCase? I thought of
creating HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse objects to pass to
my utility classes but I cannot figure out a way to pass a servlet
object.
